channel.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
channel.description: The subject says it all. My brother cant connect but everyone else can connect. Server Properties: #Minecraft server properties #Wed Dec 07 11:24:19 PST 2011 verify-names=true admin-slot=false port=25565 public=true server-name=Blank max-players=32 max-connections=3 motd=Welcome to Blank\! grow-trees=true

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

the last code is normal,go into server.properties and change online-mode to false. make sure the server’s ip is your internal ip. make sure he uses your internal ip to connect, make sure he is using an up to date client (not classic).

try all of this, then tell me if you are still having problems

Read full topic

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

This is what my cmd prompt says when he tries to connect.

EDIT: The client that I have won’t even let me connect to localhost.
It keeps saying User Not Premium when I try to connect.
I don’t want to pay to play I want to be able to play my server without.
I’m getting this in the server control panel:

item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

Minecraft.net

Download for Minecraft: Java Edition

Download the Minecraft launcher to start your adventure! Explore, build and survive! You'll still need to log in and buy a copy to play the full game.

download the minecraft_server.exe. place it in a folder alone and run it. after the server is done creating spawn, stop the server and open up server.properties(should auto download). your server.properties should look a little like this.

#Minecraft server properties
#Thu Dec 08 14:27:03 EST 2011
allow-nether=true
level-name=world
allow-flight=false
enable-query=false
server-port=25565
enable-rcon=false
level-seed=
server-ip=
white-list=false
spawn-animals=true
online-mode=true
pvp=true
difficulty=1
gamemode=0
max-players=20
spawn-monsters=true
view-distance=10
motd=A Minecraft Server

Read full topic
item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Yes there is a web-client if you go to minecraft.net and download the software they have which I assume is the “newest” one it connects directly to the web-client. Can you link me to a download page for the “newest” minecraft server cause my brother and I want to play this together.
I tried downloading MCAdmin and I set it up but it wouldnt even let me connect to localhost and kept saying something about a heartbeat failure.
PLEASE link me to a download where the server/client actually works lmfao.

Read full topic
item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

well, download the actual server. i didn’t know there was a “web-client” server. sounds kinda contradicting in some ways :P. but either way, i understand you are on the same external ip, but its not possible for you to be on the same internal ip. you need to have the server running off your external ip. if there is no way to change it, then there is no way for him to connect(being that he is on the same external ip)

being that 2 computers on the same network will never have the same internal ip, HIS will be different then yours, his computer cannot connect to your local host OR external ip

his external ip is the same as yours, so there would be no way for him to use that to connect to your computer. there may be a way around this, i would say google is a reliable source, but as for me, i havn’t found a way around it yet.

best thing i can tell you to do is to download the latest software and run your server, that way you can change the ip to your internal ip instead of local host.

Read full topic
item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Again, He is on the same IP as me and I am using the web client for my server so there is no way to change the IP of the server. I connect with 127.0.0.1 and when he connects its with my routers IP.

Read full topic
item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

again, make sure he is using your internal ip, and make sure you are connected to a network with each other. not sure if the network connection is necessary, but the internal ip is. also, make sure for server ip, you are using your internal ip(not your local host).

internal ip should look something like:

192.168.1.234

local host shoudl look like :
127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

I am able to connect as I am on right now. He gets some Failed to connect error.
I’m using the server where you start out with everything like when you go to the minecraft homepage and want to find a server to play. At the top it says want to host your own? Here’s the software.
I got that and everyone else can connect but him and I can connect to.
He is on the same IP and it is portforwarded correctly as other people can connect.
He can connect to other peoples servers aswell but mine.

Read full topic
item.source: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant

item.title: Everyone including me can connect but my brother cant
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

can connect to your own server?

run the server from your internal ip. dont use local host.
uhhhh, make sure your ports are forwarded correctly.
make sure he is on your network if using the same external ip?

not too sure, but this used to happen to me on rsps awhile ago.

also, allow him to use your internal ip to connect, whilst everyone else uses your external ip, or even a masked ip.

Read full topic
